label: FreshserviceApi
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Freshservice API.

tools.name: ActivateCsatSurvey
tools.description:
Activates a CSAT Survey by its ID in Freshservice.

Use this tool to activate a Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) Survey in Freshservice by providing the survey's ID.

parameters.name: csat_survey_id
parameters.description: The integer ID of the CSAT survey to activate in Freshservice.

tools.name: AddAssetComponent
tools.description:
Add a new component to an existing asset.

Use this tool to add a new component for a specific asset in Freshservice. It should be called when you need to track additional components associated with an asset.

parameters.name: asset_display_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the asset to which the new component will be added. This should be an integer value.

tools.name: AddNoteToProblem
tools.description:
Add a new note to a problem in Freshservice.

Use this tool to create and add a new note to an existing problem in Freshservice, helping track updates or relevant information.

parameters.name: note_html_body
parameters.description: The HTML formatted content of the note to be added to the problem.

parameters.name: problem_id
parameters.description: The ID of the problem to which the note will be added.

parameters.name: note_body_text
parameters.description: The content of the note in plain text format to be added to the problem in Freshservice.

parameters.name: note_creation_datetime
parameters.description: The date and time when the note was created, formatted as a string.

parameters.name: note_creator_user_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the user creating the note. This identifies who is responsible for the note addition.

parameters.name: note_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique ID to be assigned to the note, ensuring it is distinct within Freshservice.

parameters.name: note_updated_datetime
parameters.description: The date and time when the note was last updated. Use the format 'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ'.

parameters.name: notification_email_addresses
parameters.description: A list of email addresses to notify about the note. Each address should be in string format.

note_html_body.value: This is a new note added to track progress on the problem.

note_body_text.value: Note: Progress is being made on the issue.

tools.name: AddReleaseNote
tools.description:
Create a new note on a release in Freshservice.

Use this tool to add a note to a specific release in Freshservice. It should be called when you need to document or update information about a release.

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the release to which the note will be added.

parameters.name: note_body_html
parameters.description: Provide the note content in HTML format for the release.

parameters.name: note_body_plain_text
parameters.description: The body of the release note in plain text format. Use this for non-HTML content.

parameters.name: note_creation_datetime
parameters.description: Specify the date and time when the note was created. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ (ISO 8601 standard).

parameters.name: note_creator_user_id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the user who created the note. This ID should correspond to the user in Freshservice responsible for the note's content.

parameters.name: note_unique_id
parameters.description: Integer representing the unique ID of the note to be created.

parameters.name: note_updated_at
parameters.description: The date and time when the note was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: notification_email_addresses
parameters.description: Array of email addresses to notify about the note.

note_body_html.value: This is an update regarding the release.

note_body_plain_text.value: This is an update regarding the release.

tools.name: AddReleaseTimeEntry
tools.description:
Log a new time entry for a specific release in Freshservice.

    This tool is used to create a new time entry on a release within the Freshservice platform. It should be called when there's a need to record the time spent on a release.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: The ID of the release for which a new time entry is to be created. This should be an integer value.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddTicketNote
tools.description:
Add a new note to a Freshservice ticket.

    Use this tool to post a new note on a specific Freshservice ticket by providing the ticket ID. This is useful for updating ticket information, providing status updates, or adding additional details related to the ticket.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: ticket_id_to_add_note
parameters.description: The ID of the Freshservice ticket to which the note will be added. This ID is required to specify the particular ticket to update.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"note": "This is a test note for the ticket."}

parameters.description: The unique integer ID of the project to archive in Freshservice.

tools.name: ConvertAgentToRequester
tools.description:
Convert an agent to a requester in Freshservice.

Use this tool to convert an agent, identified by their ID, into a requester in Freshservice. This action is typically used when an agent no longer needs agent-level access.

parameters.name: agent_id_to_convert
parameters.description: The unique ID of the agent to convert to a requester.

tools.name: ConvertRequesterToAgent
tools.description:
Convert a requester to an agent in Freshservice.

Use this tool to convert a Freshservice requester into an occasional agent with the SD Agent role. This action removes any existing group memberships from the requester.

parameters.name: requester_id_to_convert
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the requester to be converted into an agent.

tools.name: CreateAssetType
tools.description:
Create a new asset type in Freshservice.

Use this tool to create a new asset type in Freshservice when setting up or managing assets. It automates the process of defining asset categories in the system.

parameters.description: The name of the asset type to be created.

parameters.description: Provide a short description of the asset type in HTML format for styling.

parameters.name: asset_type_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the asset type to be created.

tools.name: CreateCannedResponseFolder
tools.description:
Create a new canned response folder in Freshservice.

This tool creates a new canned response folder in Freshservice. Use it when you need to organize canned responses into a new folder within the Freshservice platform.

parameters.name: folder_name
parameters.description: The name of the new canned response folder to be created in Freshservice.

parameters.name: canned_response_folder_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the canned response folder. It must be an integer value.

parameters.name: folder_created_at
parameters.description: The timestamp indicating when the folder was created, formatted as a string.

parameters.name: folder_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the canned response folder, indicating its purpose or categorization.

parameters.name: initial_responses_count
parameters.description: Specify the initial number of responses in the new canned response folder, typically starting at 0.

parameters.name: updated_at_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp of the last update to the folder in ISO 8601 format.

tools.name: CreateChangeNote

parameters.name: note_body_html
parameters.description: The body of the note in HTML format. Use this to format the note with HTML tags for styling.

parameters.name: note_body_plain_text
parameters.description: The content of the change note in plain text format.

parameters.name: note_creation_datetime
parameters.description: The date and time when the note was created, in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2023-01-01T12:00:00Z').

parameters.name: note_last_updated
parameters.description: Date and time when the note was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: note_unique_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the note being created. Must be an integer.

parameters.name: notification_email_addresses
parameters.description: List of email addresses to notify about the change note.

parameters.name: user_identifier_for_note_creator
parameters.description: Unique ID of the user who created the note in Freshservice.

note_body_html.value: This is a new note regarding the change request.

note_body_plain_text.value: This is a new note regarding the change request.

Fetch a list of all asset types from Freshservice.

Use this to get an overview of all asset types defined within Freshservice. Useful for managing assets or integrating asset data with other systems.

parameters.name: entries_per_page
parameters.description: The number of asset types to retrieve per page in the list.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve for paginated results.

tools.name: ListCannedResponses
tools.description:
Retrieve canned responses from a specified folder in Freshservice.

Call this tool to obtain a list of all canned responses within a specified canned response folder in Freshservice. It's useful for accessing predefined replies saved in a particular folder.

parameters.name: canned_response_folder_id
parameters.description: The ID of the canned response folder to retrieve responses from.

tools.name: ListComponentTypes
tools.description:
Retrieve all Freshservice component types and their fields.

Use this tool to obtain a list of all component types available in Freshservice. It provides details about each component type and their specific fields, which can be useful for understanding how components are organized.

parameters.name: entries_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of component type entries to retrieve in each page.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve in a paginated list of component types.

tools.name: ListFreshserviceAgents
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all agents from Freshservice.

Call this tool to get a comprehensive list of all agents present in your Freshservice account. It will return the agent details necessary for managing or reviewing team configurations.

parameters.name: agent_employment_status
parameters.description: Specifies if the list should include full-time or occasional agents. Use 'fulltime' or 'occasional'.

parameters.name: entries_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of entries to retrieve per page in the result set.

parameters.name: filter_by_mobile_phone_number
parameters.description: Filter agents by the given mobile phone number.

parameters.name: filter_by_work_phone_number
parameters.description: Filter agents by their work phone number to retrieve corresponding requesters.

parameters.name: list_active_accounts
parameters.description: List only active user accounts. Use true for active accounts, false for deactivated ones.

parameters.name: page_number_to_retrieve
parameters.description: The specific page number to retrieve in the list of Freshservice agents.

parameters.name: query_filter
parameters.description: A URL-encoded query string to filter agents based on parameters like first_name, job_title, etc. Example: "job_title:'HR Manager' AND created_at:>'2018-08-10'".

parameters.name: requester_email
parameters.description: The email address to find the corresponding requester agent in Freshservice.

tools.name: ListFreshserviceProjects
tools.description:
Retrieve all projects from Freshservice.

Use this tool to obtain a comprehensive list of projects stored in the Freshservice platform. Ideal for users needing to access or review project details managed within Freshservice.

parameters.name: entries_per_page
parameters.description: The number of projects to retrieve per page in a paginated result set from Freshservice.

parameters.name: filter_archived_projects
parameters.description: Set to true to retrieve archived projects, false for active projects.

parameters.name: filter_project_status
parameters.description: Filter projects based on their status: all, open, in_progress, or completed.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The specific page number of projects to retrieve for paginated results.

tools.name: ListFreshserviceTickets
tools.description:
Fetch a list of tickets from Freshservice.

Use this tool to retrieve all tickets currently in Freshservice. Ideal for viewing open or closed tickets and managing support inquiries.

parameters.name: filter_by_requester_email
parameters.description: Filter tickets by the requester's email address.

parameters.name: include_fields_in_response
parameters.description: Specify certain fields to include in the response. Examples: 'stats' for ticket's closed and resolved times, 'requester' for requester's details.

parameters.name: requester_id_filter
parameters.description: Filter tickets by the ID of the requester to view those created by a specific user.

parameters.name: ticket_filter
parameters.description: Apply a pre-defined filter to fetch specific types of tickets. Options are: new_and_my_open, watching, spam, deleted.

parameters.name: ticket_sort_order
parameters.description: Sort the list of tickets in ascending ('asc') or descending ('desc') order. Default is 'desc'.

parameters.name: updated_since
parameters.description: Filter tickets based on their update timestamp. Use ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2015-01-19T02:00:00Z'.

tools.name: ListRequesterFields
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all requester fields in Freshservice.

Use this tool to obtain a complete list of requester fields in your Freshservice instance.

parameters.name: entries_per_page
parameters.description: Number of requester fields to retrieve per page in the paginated list.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve in a paginated list of requester fields.

tools.name: ListSoftwareApplications
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of software applications from Freshservice.

Use this tool to get a comprehensive list of all software applications available in Freshservice. This can be helpful for inventory management or IT support inquiries.

parameters.name: entries_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of software application entries to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: page_number_to_retrieve
parameters.description: The specific page number of the software list to retrieve from Freshservice. Useful for navigating large lists.

tools.name: MergeSecondaryRequesters
tools.description:
Merge secondary requesters into a primary requester.

Use this tool to combine one or more secondary requester profiles into a primary requester profile, consolidating their information into a single account.

parameters.name: primary_requester_id
parameters.description: The ID of the primary requester to merge other requesters into.

parameters.name: secondary_requester_ids
parameters.description: List of IDs of secondary requesters to be merged into the primary requester.

tools.name: PostTicketReply
tools.description:
Add a reply to a Freshservice ticket.

    This tool allows you to post a new reply to a specified ticket in Freshservice. Use it when you need to update a ticket with additional information or respond to queries.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: ticket_id
parameters.description: ID of the ticket to which the reply will be added. This must be an integer representing the unique identifier of the ticket.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"body":"Thank you for your patience. Please let me know if you have any further questions."}

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: vendor_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the vendor to be updated. It must be an integer.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"name": "New Vendor Name", "contact_email": "contact@vendor.com", "address": "123 Vendor St, City, Country"}

summary:
FreshserviceApi provides a toolkit that enables seamless interaction with the Freshservice API, facilitating various operations for managing IT service requests. This toolkit empowers developers to automate and streamline service desk actions effectively.

**Capabilities**
- Activate and manage Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) surveys.
- Add, update, and delete tasks, notes, and details for tickets, projects, changes, and problems.
- Retrieve comprehensive details for assets, vendors, agents, and requests.
- Manage organizational structures by creating or deleting departments, agent groups, and solutions.
- Effortlessly handle asset and project management with detailed tracking features.

**Secrets**
- Securely manage API keys, tokens, and private keys, e.g., FRESHSERVICE_API_KEY, enhancing the integrity of API calls.
